page.title: 10Mills,Barges and Locks.
page.content: Our area has contained mills until this century.Langford Mill is mentioned in the Domesday Book.A special cut from the canal runs up to it.Since 1924 the mill has been used to house pumping equipment. The first sugar beet mill in Britain opened in the 1830's by Marriage,Reid and Marriage was at the Hoe Mill Lock Ulting.It no longer exists but Hoe Mill House and four sugar workers cottages still remind us of this famous Industry. The canal used to take away the produce of these mills.Its barges also carried timber between Maldon and Chelmsford.Now all the Barges are owned for pleasure.One original 18th Century brick canal bridge survives at Rickets Lock.
